p.s: The given speech was delivered by Boris Johnson, the British Prime Minister, at COP26 Leaders' Summit Opening Ceremony on 1st November 2021.
It deals with Boris Johnson's idea of the climate crisis and his view of the role and importance of COP26.
Boris Johnson thinks that climate change will end our loves as we know it.
We do not have much time left to do something against it because the temperature of the planet rises faster and fast.
He has the opinion that the function of COP26 is to agree on things that we will implement.

In Copenhagen and Paris, they agreed to a net zero and that the temperature should not rise more than 1,5 degrees but that are just promises which will not change something if they are not following actions.
Furthermore he thinks that we have the technology to change something In addition we also have the funds to help developing countries.
He says that we need the help of the market, because they have much more funds.
But the will to change something is also important.
He explains that the politicians have the responsibility to decrease global warming.
They are the people who can change some thing but future generations are the one who will suffer if the politicians will fail.
Johnson thinks that COP26 Will not be the last thing who is about climate change.
He says that the politicians have everything to do something against climate change and they should not fail because of future generations.
At the end he makes clear that is not going to be easy but it is feasible.
All in all, his opinion is that we have act now because the politicians have no time to wait.
The COP26 is important to agree on things the politicians will do.
But in the future there will be more the politicians have to do.
They also have the possibilities and responsibility to act now.
